text_of_the_post.text: Here will come review of RTC360

main_image.copyright: Leica RTC360 used on the construction side

subtitle.text: Is RTC360 the best scanner in its class?

image_banner.copyright: RTC360 scans the oil platform in Norway

rich_text_in_post.text:
Have you ever wondered how to be more efficient with laser scanning delivery? Trimble is coming with the simple answer – constrain, export and deliver the data directly from the field. Is it really efficient and good solution? How does it work? And is it worth? You will get answers on these questions and my subjective rate about Trimble X7.

Specs

First impression

 

Trimble X7 sprawia wrazenie solidnego high-endowego urzadzenia. It looks differently comparing to its competitors like Leica RTC360, Faro S150 or Z+F Imager 5016. The spinning mirror is covered by cylindrical element/tube with glassy/shiny stripe  and 3x coaxial 10MP cameras next to it. Under the heart of the scanner is placed element which looks like UFO with many lights around. It is not rotatable leveler of the scanner’s body which is able to automatically level X7 in range of 10deg.

Whole scanner weight slightly over 6kg (with the battery) so it is placing in between RTC360 and Z+F 5016 (approx. 7.5kg including 2 batteries). W przeciwie≈Ñstwie do competitors X7’s body has big handle which helps to place it on the tripod and safely take it off or transport in your hand between scan stations, in case you do the acquisition in difficult conditions and tight places. I found out it very helpful but not required.
